oai_dc:dc.dc:title: FIELD INVESTIGATION AT A MOUTH OF SMALL RIVER
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Yanaka, Hitoshi
Shuto, Nubuo
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: river mouth
small river
field investigation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Field measurements have been carried out at the mouth of the Nanakita River in Japan. The maximum velocity at the throat section was kept constant, 1 m/sec, although the river mouth topography changed much rapidly in a week. It therefore seems that the equilibrium condition at the river mouth can be expressed in terms of the maximum velocity. The wave set-up height measured in the river mouth was also analyzed and was found to be responsible for the intrusion of sand into the mouth.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 23 (1992): Proceedings of 23rd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Venice, Italy, 1992.
